definition: a building of two or more stories/CL:棟|栋[dong4],幢[zhuang4],座[zuo4]
house with more than 1 story/storied building/floor/CL:層|层[ceng2],座[zuo4],棟|栋[dong4]
house/room/CL:間|间[jian1]/branch of an extended family/classifier for family members (or concubines)

sentences.english: Many buildings are irregular " heteromorphosis" construction.
sentences.chinese: 不少樓房是不規則的“異型”建築。

sentences.english: Development doesn't mean building high, buildings with tiny rooms.
sentences.chinese: 發展並不意味著高樓房小單位的建設。

sentences.english: Therefore, building structures that can withstand the power of earthquakes is a major concern.
sentences.chinese: 所以，建造具有抗震能力的樓房結構成爲關注的重點。

sentences.english: She said four six-story buildings on her street had been flattened.
sentences.chinese: 她說在她所在的那條街有四個六層的樓房被夷平。

sentences.english: The owners of a building on Times Square held that first party on top of their building.
sentences.chinese: 時代廣場的樓房業主在樓頂上舉行了第一次派對。

sentences.english: Does it make you a king to have more and more cedar?
sentences.chinese: 難道你作王是在乎造香柏木樓房爭勝嗎？

sentences.english: They shift the place of tree planting into building, but they plant basin scenery at home.
sentences.chinese: 把路邊上植樹的地方又來蓋樓房，在家裏在盆景。

sentences.english: Things are so different that Chinese farmers have also built up their apartment buildings and villas .
sentences.chinese: 如今情況不同了，中國的農民也蓋起了樓房和別墅。

sentences.english: It could be years before the building is renovated .
sentences.chinese: 等到這樓房裝修完，可得哪年哪月。

sentences.english: As for our village every family live in a building, I know not.
sentences.chinese: 至於我們村家家戶戶住樓房的事，我知道不現實。

sentences.english: The building opposite the postoffice is a bookstore.
sentences.chinese: 郵局對面的那座樓房是一間書店。

sentences.english: That would make the high towers in the range of a20+ floor high common building.
sentences.chinese: 這就是說高塔樓都在普通樓房的20層以上。

sentences.english: In the cliff there were doors---of two storeys high.
sentences.chinese: 在懸崖上有兩層樓房高的門。

sentences.english: The building opposite to the postoffice is a bookstore .
sentences.chinese: 郵局對面的那座樓房是一間書店。

sentences.english: How soon was the building completed?
sentences.chinese: 這樓房是在多長時間之內蓋得的？

sentences.english: Old Behrman was a painter who lived on the ground floor beneath them.
sentences.chinese: 老貝爾門是住在她們這座樓房底層的一個畫家。

definition: tenement building, typically of 2-4 stories, with a shop on the ground floor and upper floors used for residential purposes (esp. in southern China)
building (a relatively large, multi-storey one)/CL:幢[zhuang4],座[zuo4]
to demolish a building and relocate the inhabitants
to decorate/interior decoration/to fit up/to renovate
car or other vehicle (bicycle, truck etc)
